content.description: A crack that was thickly covered in lichen & spiderwebs you couldn't see through. It looked like it could be a cool little crack climb and it was. Sit start with hands matched in the lowest point along the crack. First moves are the crux. Work your way up the crack to good holds and top out one of a few ways. Topping out directly above the crack might be the most fun and keeps the crack climbing style of movement going a little longer.Â
content.location: This crack is located in the center of the last short cliff band before you come to the scenic lookout point overlooking the lake when you first summit the ridge. It is in a corner and nearby two boulders laid onto eachother to form a small cave/tunnel between the rocks right off the trail and hard to miss.

content.description: A few small bands of bouldering walls on the way up to the first scenic view point going up the blue trail to the top of the ridge from the main parking lot off Hill Street.
